definitions: footrace covering exactly 26.2 miles or 42.195 kilometers usually run on roads
sustained effort or activity that requires considerable endurance and continues for an extended period
examples: She trained six months for the Boston Marathon
The marathon runners crossed the finish line after four hours
The contract negotiations turned into a marathon lasting eighteen hours
They held a movie marathon watching all eight films consecutively

definitions: third month of the year containing thirty-one days between February and April
organized procession of people walking together to demonstrate support for or opposition to something
steady rhythmic walking movement especially of soldiers moving in formation
musical composition with strong regular rhythm written for marching
frontier region or borderland between territories or countries historically under military jurisdiction
examples: Spring officially begins in March this year
The conference is scheduled for late March
Thousands joined the march for civil rights downtown
The protest march proceeded peacefully through the streets
The troops began their march at dawn
The battalion completed a twenty-mile march
The band played Sousa's famous march
The wedding processional featured a traditional march
The Welsh Marches formed the border with England
Medieval lords controlled the march territories

definitions: member of a military force trained to serve on land and sea especially a member of the U.S. Marine Corps
relating to or found in the sea or ocean environment
examples: The marine served three tours overseas
Marines underwent rigorous amphibious training
Marine biology studies ocean ecosystems
The marine environment faces pollution threats

definitions: visible sign, spot, or stain on a surface that distinguishes it
grade or score given to evaluate academic performance or achievement
target or goal that someone aims to reach or achieve
former monetary unit of Germany replaced by the euro
author of the second Gospel in the New Testament
examples: The coffee left a mark on the table
Scratch marks covered the wooden floor
She received high marks on her exam
The teacher gave full marks for creativity
The arrow missed its mark completely
Sales fell short of the mark this quarter
The price was fifty marks before conversion
The Deutsche Mark was Germany's currency
The Gospel of Mark describes Jesus's ministry
Mark wrote the shortest gospel account

definitions: fortified wine from Sicily ranging from dry to sweet often used in cooking
examples: The recipe calls for dry marsala wine
She served marsala with the dessert course

definitions: national anthem of France composed in 1792 during the French Revolution
examples: The crowd sang the Marseillaise at the ceremony
The Marseillaise played as the team entered the stadium

definitions: area of low-lying land that is flooded in wet seasons or at high tide typically waterlogged at all times
examples: Birds nested in the coastal marsh
The marsh provides habitat for numerous species

definitions: high-ranking military officer or law enforcement official with administrative and ceremonial duties
person who organizes and directs ceremonial events or parades
examples: The fire marshall inspected the building
The U.S. Marshall pursued the fugitive
The parade marshall led the procession
They appointed a marshall for the ceremony

definitions: hypothetical or fictional being from the planet Mars
relating to or characteristic of the planet Mars
examples: Science fiction often depicts Martians as green
The movie featured an invasion by Martians
The Martian landscape appears red and barren
Scientists study Martian soil samples

definitions: political and economic theory developed by Karl Marx advocating class struggle and revolutionary change leading to a classless society
examples: Students studied Marxism in political theory class
Marxism influenced many twentieth-century revolutionary movements

definitions: person who follows or advocates the political and economic theories of Karl Marx
examples: The Marxist argued for collective ownership
Several Marxist scholars attended the conference

definitions: dough made from corn flour used in Latin American cooking especially for tortillas and tamales
examples: She prepared fresh masa for the tamales
The tortillas require masa harina flour

definitions: member of an East African people living in Kenya and Tanzania known for semi-nomadic pastoralism
examples: The Masai maintain traditional cattle herding practices
Masai warriors performed a ceremonial dance

definitions: craftsperson who builds with stone, brick, or concrete blocks
member of the fraternal organization of Freemasons
examples: The mason carefully laid each brick
They hired a mason to build the fireplace
His grandfather was a Mason for forty years
The Mason lodge meets monthly downtown

definitions: building work done by a mason using stone, brick, or concrete blocks
principles and practices of the Freemason fraternal organization
examples: The masonry walls have lasted centuries
They specialize in decorative masonry work
He studied the history of Masonry
Masonry emphasizes moral and spiritual values

definitions: Christian ceremony commemorating the Last Supper held on the Thursday before Easter
examples: The church held a Maundy Thursday service
Maundy ceremonies include foot washing rituals

definitions: person from or citizen of Mauritania in northwest Africa
examples: The Mauritanian delegation attended the summit
Many Mauritanians speak Arabic and French

definitions: person from or citizen of the island nation of Mauritius in the Indian Ocean
examples: The Mauritian economy relies heavily on tourism
Mauritian cuisine blends Indian, Chinese, and French influences

definitions: type of magazine-fed bolt-action rifle originally manufactured in Germany
examples: The collector owned several vintage Mauser rifles
Mauser designs influenced military rifles worldwide

definitions: concise statement expressing a general truth or rule of conduct
early type of automatic machine gun invented by Hiram Maxim
examples: The ancient maxim advises moderation in all things
His favorite maxim was 'honesty is the best policy'
The Maxim gun revolutionized warfare
British forces used Maxim guns extensively

definitions: fifth month of the year containing thirty-one days between April and June
flowering hawthorn tree or its blossoms associated with spring
examples: Graduation ceremonies occur in May
May brings warmer weather and flowers
The may bloomed along the hedgerows
Children gathered may blossoms for garlands

definitions: member of an indigenous people of Mexico and Central America who developed an advanced pre-Columbian civilization
Hindu philosophical concept of illusion or the material world as deceptive appearance
examples: The Maya built impressive pyramid temples
Maya astronomy was remarkably sophisticated
Buddhist teachings describe maya as illusion
Overcoming maya leads to enlightenment

definitions: relating to the Maya people or their culture and civilization
language family spoken by the Maya peoples of Mesoamerica
examples: Mayan hieroglyphs were finally deciphered
The Mayan calendar system was highly complex
She studied Mayan languages in Guatemala
Several million people speak Mayan languages today

definitions: international radio distress signal used by ships and aircraft in life-threatening emergencies
examples: The pilot transmitted a mayday call before ditching
Coast Guard responded to the mayday signal immediately

definitions: megabit, a unit of computer data equal to one million bits
examples: The connection speed reached 100 Mbit per second
The file transfer required several Mbit of bandwidth

definitions: practice of making accusations of disloyalty or subversion without proper evidence named after Senator Joseph McCarthy
examples: McCarthyism destroyed many careers in the 1950s
The era of McCarthyism created widespread fear and suspicion

definitions: megaelectron volt, a unit of energy used in particle physics equal to one million electron volts
examples: The particle beam reached energies of 500 MeV
Gamma rays typically have energies measured in MeV

definitions: alcoholic beverage created by fermenting honey with water sometimes with fruits or spices
poetic or archaic term for meadow or field
examples: Vikings traditionally drank mead at celebrations
The meadery produces several varieties of mead
Sheep grazed upon the verdant mead
The cottage overlooked a flowering mead

definitions: holiest city in Islam located in Saudi Arabia where Muslims face during prayer
place that attracts many people with a particular interest
examples: Muslims make pilgrimage to Mecca annually
The Kaaba in Mecca is Islam's holiest site
Silicon Valley became a mecca for entrepreneurs
Nashville is a mecca for country music fans

definitions: sorceress in Greek mythology who helped Jason obtain the Golden Fleece and later killed her children
examples: Medea's story inspired numerous dramatic works
Euripides wrote a famous tragedy about Medea

definitions: United States federal and state program providing medical assistance to low-income individuals and families
examples: Medicaid covers millions of American children
She qualified for Medicaid after losing her job

definitions: United States federal health insurance program primarily for people aged sixty-five and older
examples: Medicare enrollment begins at age sixty-five
The hospital accepts Medicare patients

definitions: large sea surrounded by Europe, Africa, and Asia connecting to the Atlantic Ocean
climate characterized by hot dry summers and mild wet winters
cuisine style from countries bordering the Mediterranean Sea emphasizing olive oil, vegetables, and seafood
examples: Ships crossed the Mediterranean for centuries
The Mediterranean connects three continents
California has a Mediterranean climate
Mediterranean climates support olive cultivation
The Mediterranean diet emphasizes fresh vegetables
Mediterranean cuisine uses abundant olive oil

definitions: monster in Greek mythology with snakes for hair whose gaze turned people to stone
free-swimming sexual form of certain cnidarians including jellyfish
examples: Perseus slew Medusa using a mirrored shield
Medusa's head became a protective symbol
The medusa stage follows the polyp stage
Jellyfish exist primarily in medusa form

definitions: relating to Gregor Mendel's principles of heredity describing inheritance patterns of traits
examples: Mendelian inheritance explains many genetic traits
The disease follows a Mendelian pattern

definitions: member of a Protestant Christian denomination emphasizing adult baptism, pacifism, and simple living
examples: Mennonites practice believer's baptism
The Mennonite community operates numerous charities

definitions: seven or nine-branched candelabrum used in Jewish worship especially during Hanukkah
examples: They lit the menorah for eight nights
The temple menorah has seven branches

definitions: international society for people with high intelligence quotient scores
flat top surface of an altar in Christian churches
examples: Mensa membership requires a qualifying IQ score
The local Mensa chapter meets monthly
The priest placed the chalice on the mensa
The marble mensa dates from medieval times

definitions: dealer in textiles especially expensive fabrics like silk and velvet historically important in medieval trade
examples: The mercer displayed fine silks from Asia
Medieval mercers belonged to powerful guilds

definitions: heavy silvery metallic element that is liquid at room temperature, toxic to humans
smallest planet in the solar system and closest to the sun
Roman god of commerce, travel, and communication equivalent to Greek Hermes
column of mercury in a thermometer or barometer used to measure temperature or pressure
examples: Mercury thermometers are being phased out
Mercury contamination poses serious health risks
Mercury completes an orbit in eighty-eight days
Mercury has extreme temperature variations
Mercury served as messenger of the gods
The statue depicts Mercury with winged sandals
The mercury rose to ninety degrees
Falling mercury indicates approaching storms

definitions: imaginary line on Earth's surface from North to South Pole marking longitude
highest point reached by a celestial body in its daily path
pathway in traditional Chinese medicine through which vital energy flows
examples: Greenwich marks the prime meridian
Ships navigate using meridians and parallels
The sun reached its meridian at noon
Stars cross the meridian at predictable times
Acupuncture targets specific meridian points
Energy flows through twelve major meridians

definitions: legendary wizard and advisor to King Arthur in Arthurian legend
small falcon found across the Northern Hemisphere that hunts small birds
examples: Merlin prophesied Arthur's rise to power
The wizard Merlin appears in countless stories
The merlin caught a sparrow mid-flight
Merlins nest in northern forests

definitions: dark blue-colored wine grape variety used to make red wine known for soft texture
examples: The vineyard specializes in merlot production
This merlot pairs well with roasted meats

definitions: legendary male creature with the upper body of a man and the tail of a fish
examples: Sailors told tales of merman sightings
The merman appears in various maritime folklore

definitions: isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides found in arid regions especially the southwestern United States
examples: Native Americans built dwellings atop the mesa
The mesa rises dramatically from the desert floor

definitions: relating to the historical and cultural region extending from central Mexico through Central America before Spanish colonization
examples: Mesoamerican civilizations developed complex calendars
Mesoamerican art features distinctive symbolic motifs

definitions: Middle Stone Age period between Paleolithic and Neolithic characterized by development of microliths and fishing
examples: Mesolithic hunters used smaller stone tools
The Mesolithic period saw increased seafood consumption

definitions: geological era from about 252 to 66 million years ago known as the age of dinosaurs
examples: Dinosaurs dominated during the Mesozoic era
The Mesozoic ended with a mass extinction event

definitions: promised deliverer of the Jewish people prophesied in Hebrew scripture and identified by Christians as Jesus
leader regarded as a savior or liberator of a people or cause
examples: Christians believe Jesus is the Messiah
Jewish texts describe the coming Messiah
Some viewed him as a political messiah
They awaited a messiah to solve their problems

definitions: Protestant Christian denomination originating from John Wesley's reform movement emphasizing personal faith and social holiness
examples: Methodism spread rapidly in nineteenth-century America
Methodism emphasizes both personal salvation and social justice
